alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 8:54AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of central Humboldt and southeastern Del Norte Counties through 930 AM PST... At 852 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Klamath to 6 miles northwest of Petrolia. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Small hail may cover roadways and create slipper conditions. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Arcata, Klamath, Orick, Grizzly Creek Redwoods State Park, Honeydew, Willow Creek, Fortuna, Rio Dell, McKinleyville, Maple Creek, Carlotta, Westhaven-Moonstone, Scotia, Pepperwood, Petrolia, Ferndale, Blue Lake, Myrtletown and Cutten. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Small hail may accumulate on roadways and create slippery conditions.
